title: Involving users and collaborating between disciplines in making cultural heritage accessible for research

author: Rickard Domeij, Institute for language and folklore

In detail to project, we will examine how speech technology methods can make speech recordings at public memory institutions more accessible for researchers, so so that's the main goal, and the project is funded by the Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Science from 2017 to 2020.

An folklore archives in Uppsala and and Gothenburg with large amounts of data in text and speech.

So the archives houses Bonner, Sweden's largest folklore collections as well as extensive dialect transcriptions and recordings.
And in the Tiltle project we will explore how speech, technology, methods and tools can be adapted and developed to process large amounts of historical voice recordings from the archives.
And currently the large amounts of recorded speech available at the Swedish memory institutions are rarely used due to the lack of effective methods for handling archive sound material.
